definition: to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit
to resemble/to be like/to look as if/such as/appearance/image/portrait/image under a mapping (math.)

sentences.english: When I’m making the poems, it doesn’t feel like work. It feels like play.
sentences.chinese: 当我创作诗歌的时候，不像是工作，倒像在娱乐。

sentences.english: Sounds like a plan to me.
sentences.chinese: 我听起来这倒像是个计划。

sentences.english: It looked like a bundle of glowing gas.
You’re gonna act like you don’t understand? Don’t even try to pretend you’re one of them.
sentences.chinese: 你看起来倒像什么都不懂，别装着自己是她们一伙的。

sentences.english: She looked like somebody we would've been friends with.
sentences.chinese: 但问题是她看起来不像娘子，倒像个朋友。

sentences.english: It was like the two halves of a countersign .
sentences.chinese: 这倒像个接头暗号分成了两半。

sentences.english: Viewed from the outside, the company seemed genuine.
sentences.chinese: 从外表上看，这家公司倒像是真的。

sentences.english: It seems more like armor, than an item of clothing.
sentences.chinese: 它看起来不像衣服，倒像盔甲。

definition: to look exactly like/to be the spitting image of
seems as if/rather like/Taiwan pr. [si4 de5]
(literary) to be exactly like/to be exactly as if
